data.title: Steven Sterrett Obituary - ERIE, Pennsylvania
data.meta_description: Steven William Sterrett, 38, a resident of Harborcreek Township, died on Friday afternoon August 17, 2007 at the Atlantic City Medical Center in Atlantic City, NJ following an automobile accident near Barnegate, NJ.  A resident of the Erie area most of his life, he was born in Fairview Park, Ohio on March 21, 1969 a son of Dennis F. Sterrett and Jeanne Durchman Todd Sterrett of Lawrence Park.  Steven was the co-owner for the past 16 years of the Melody Dairy Mart on East Lake Road in Erie. He was a 1987 graduate of Iroquois High School and attended Penn State University for several years.  He enjoyed life, his family (especially his wife and 2 sons), his friends, playing cards, working out at the East side YMCA, and playing basketball. Steven was a huge sports fan who especially followed the Cleveland Indians and Cleveland Browns.  In addition to his parents, survivors include his wife of 10 years Sheila Fitzgerald Sterrett; 2 sons, Lucas and Andrew Sterrett, both at home; a brother, Keith Todd of Lahaina, Maui, Hawaii; 2 sisters, Lynn McCullough and her husband David and their 2 sons, Ryan and Mitchell Dabrowski of Lawrence Park, and Whitnie Storey and her husband Terrence and their daughter Peyton Storey of Chatham, NJ; his maternal grandmother Marion Durchman of Harborcreek; a number of aunts, uncles, and cousins also survive.  Friends may call at the Russell C. Schmidt & Son Funeral Home, 5000 Wattsburg Road, Erie, corner of East Gore Road and Pine Ave., Friday 2 to 5 and 7 to 9 PM and are invited to services there on Saturday morning at 10:00 AM officiated by the Rev. Keith Cutshall, Pastor of the Lawrence Park United Methodist Church.  Burial will be in Wintergreen Gorge Cemetery.  If desired, memorials may be made to the Lucas & Andrew Sterrett College Education Fund,  PNC Bank, P.O. Box 8480, Erie, PA 16553.
data.text:
Steven William Sterrett, 38, a resident of Harborcreek Township, died on Friday afternoon August 17, 2007 at the Atlantic City Medical Center in Atlantic City, NJ following an automobile accident near Barnegate, NJ.

A resident of the Erie area most of his life, he was born in Fairview Park, Ohio on March 21, 1969 a son of Dennis F. Sterrett and Jeanne Durchman Todd Sterrett of Lawrence Park.

Steven was the co-owner for the past 16 years of the Melody Dairy Mart on East Lake Road in Erie. He was a 1987 graduate of Iroquois High School and attended Penn State University for several years.

He enjoyed life, his family (especially his wife and 2 sons), his friends, playing cards, working out at the East side YMCA, and playing basketball. Steven was a huge sports fan who especially followed the Cleveland Indians and Cleveland Browns.

In addition to his parents, survivors include his wife of 10 years Sheila Fitzgerald Sterrett; 2 sons, Lucas and Andrew Sterrett, both at home; a brother, Keith Todd of Lahaina, Maui, Hawaii; 2 sisters, Lynn McCullough and her husband David and their 2 sons, Ryan and Mitchell Dabrowski of Lawrence Park, and Whitnie Storey and her husband Terrence and their daughter Peyton Storey of Chatham, NJ; his maternal grandmother Marion Durchman of Harborcreek; a number of aunts, uncles, and cousins also survive.

Friends may call at the Russell C. Schmidt & Son Funeral Home, 5000 Wattsburg Road, Erie, corner of East Gore Road and Pine Ave., Friday 2 to 5 and 7 to 9 PM and are invited to services there on Saturday morning at 10:00 AM officiated by the Rev. Keith Cutshall, Pastor of the Lawrence Park United Methodist Church.

Burial will be in Wintergreen Gorge Cemetery. If desired, memorials may be made to the Lucas & Andrew Sterrett College Education Fund, PNC Bank, P.O. Box 8480, Erie, PA 16553.
